intro: Urena meyeri, commonly known as Meyer's urena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, often clustered in inflorescences. Urena meyeri is commonly found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
